H0.text: Tundra is the biome that an area is most likely part of if it is semiarid, has few trees, and is home to ground‑nesting birds.

H1.text: Taiga is the biome most likely part of an area that is semiarid, has few trees, and is home to ground‑nesting birds.

H2.text: Grassland is an area that is semiarid, has few trees, and is home to ground‑nesting birds.

H3.text: Desert is the biome that is semiarid, has few trees, and is home to ground‑nesting birds.

A4.text: The taiga has coniferous forests, which are dense, indicating that it has many trees rather than few.

A5.text: In the interior of the continents, with the driest climates, the boreal forests might grade into temperate grassland, suggesting that grassland can exist in drier regions.
